cleaned_text: ips change all the time the vast majority of the world uses variable ip addresses which means that each time you disconnect your mobile phone for example from wifi and gsm networks then reconnect between <number> minutes to <number> hours later depending on some variables you get a new ip address the same goes for your home router disconnect it for the amount of time your isp or network provider has set for your ip to release and then reconnect it then youll have a new ip address the only cases where static ip addresses are widely used are when companies have either bought ip addresses or have leased them from the isp or network provider so ip addresses change a lot which means that any ip addresses you have or any ip address youve collected might as well be used by someone else but it might not be someone elses yet it all depends how long the isp lets a device hold the ip address how long the device has had an uninterrupted internet connection and much much more
label: r/information_security
